data.text: @GosiaGasperoPhD @Ianatan_Duine That would require grownups to act like grownups and I’m not seeing a whole lot of that anymore
@GennadySimanovs @GosiaGasperoPhD The virus does what viruses do, infect. It’s the Politicians and public health that aren’t reading — the data or the peer reviewed science.
@OG97921596 @GosiaGasperoPhD Texas, UK, Alberta do the same thing.

@GosiaGasperoPhD @ShaunMahood US measures of proportion of BA.2/(total covid) for say 2/19 vary each week.  Today's rpt 1%, 2.2%,3.8%, 6.6%, 11.6% for past 5 Saturdays.  The increase is due to the decline in BA.1, BA.2 seems pretty level for past month
. https://t.co/Z9gpp6YOHC

@GosiaGasperoPhD this is exactly what happened in the US last winter as the covid-19 surge declined with a transmission rate ~ .092 and Alpha spread with a transmission rate of .143 about 56% more contagious.  Only the 3 million shot per day vaccination campaign could suppress Alpha. https://t.co/xDzWkfLDJJ
@demandsbetter @Mrhockey1231 @GosiaGasperoPhD It has an ending? I thought it was one of those looping animated gifs.

@GosiaGasperoPhD @nyc118 The problem is that the general public in Alberta that are not ‘ferreting’ out information for themselves or following people like yourself, continue as though Covid has left!!
